subject: Physical Fitness
title: Muscle Damage and Repair
description: A fast breakdown of Muscle Damage and Repair for builders.

hook.text: Soreness after a workout means your muscles are damaged. But that damage is the point.

buildup.text: Eccentric movements â€” lowering a weight â€” cause the most damage. Fibers literally tear at the microscale.

discovery.text: Inflammation floods the area with immune cells. They clean debris and signal satellite cells to repair.

twist.text: Too much damage overwhelms repair capacity. Extreme soreness means you overdid it, not that you grew more.

climax.text: Moderate damage with adequate recovery is the sweet spot. The body repairs and adds a little extra.

punchline.text: Controlled damage triggers growth. Excessive damage just hurts.
